definition: to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of

sentences.english: The vegetable farmers space out the Chinese cabbage about 30cm apart.
sentences.chinese: 菜农每隔约30公分种一颗大白菜。

sentences.english: There is a tree every few meters on either side of the road .
sentences.chinese: 路的两边每隔几米就有一棵树。

sentences.english: I ask you to teach me every other day.
sentences.chinese: 我请你每隔一天来教我。

sentences.english: There is no need to reapply it for several hours which makes it also long lasting.
sentences.chinese: 持续时间很长，不需要每隔几个小时就涂一次。

sentences.english: So they kept switching workers every couple of months.
sentences.chinese: 所以，他们才坚持每隔两三个月就换一茬工人。

sentences.english: Yeah, and I do an hour of aerobics every other day.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我每隔一天做一个小时的健身操。

sentences.english: They have Japanese lessons every other day.
sentences.chinese: 他们每隔一天上一次日语课。

sentences.english: Children are tested every six weeks on their reading, writing, speaking and listening comprehension.
sentences.chinese: 每隔六周就会对孩子们进行听说读写的测试。

sentences.english: These arrangements are subject to periodic reviews.
sentences.chinese: 这几项安排每隔一定时间须予复查。

sentences.english: There's bus every ten to fifteen minutes.
sentences.chinese: 每隔十到十五分钟有趟车。

sentences.english: Every two days, set the alarm for just 10minutes earlier.
sentences.chinese: 每隔两天，将你的闹表往前调个10分钟。

sentences.english: Plan your shopping for a couple hours once every two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 计划好你要买的东西，每隔两周去购物一次。

sentences.english: I've been memorizing scripts, regularly since I was about 14 years old.
sentences.chinese: 我从14岁起就开始每隔一段时间就会背诵台词。

sentences.english: The Cullens went out for holidays at two months intervals.
sentences.chinese: 库伦一家每隔两个月都要外出度假一次。

sentences.english: He went to see his parents in the country every three weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他每隔两周去看望他乡下的父母。

sentences.english: About once a year, houses made from adobe should be given a layer of mud.
sentences.chinese: 大约每隔一年，砖坯制的房屋应该再铺上一层泥。

definition: gap/interval/compartment/to divide/to separate/to leave a gap of (two weeks, three meters etc)
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
to fix a time/fixed time/timed (of explosive etc)
to extend as long as/to lengthen out to
up to the maximum/upper limit/at most
around/from beginning to end/all around/front and rear
